string.text: Artefact container
Backpack
A backpack made of durable material able to withstand the most harsh weather conditions.\n \n%c[255,255,255,0]Double-click to place on the ground.
Sleeping bag
A portable sleeping bag designed to keep the user warm and hidden at night.\n \n%c[255,255,255,0]Double-click to place on the ground.
Sleep
A durable backpack with various pouches and compartments equipped with quick release clips; giving the ability to drop the field kit at a moment's notice.
Gunsmith kit
A kit containing oils and tools used for basic firearm maintenance. Useful when out exploring, but also quite heavy.\n \n%c[255,255,255,0]Drag onto the item you wish to repair.
Sewing kit
A makeshift kit of sewing equipment and spare materials for outfit maintenance. Useful for repairing holes and tears in armour.\n \n%c[255,255,255,0]Drag onto the item you wish to repair.
Are you sure you would like to repair %s?\n \n%c[255,1,255,1]+%s%
The item is beyond repair with these tools.
These tools aren't enough to repair this item further.
Military tent
Military shelter, made to withstand harsh weather. To place the tent, raise it in an open space.
LED lantern
A bulky, durable and powerful lamp running on lithium-ion batteries. For stationary use, it should be placed on the ground.
Eye of the Noosphere

One of the most mysterious artefacts in the Zone, the Eye of the Noosphere can transport its wielder back in time, even to escape death. A tight squeeze of the artefact activates its ability, creating a restoration point to go back to on activation or death. Frequent use can cause the artefact to change colour, but if discharged too frequently it may cease to function altogether. The Eye gradually restores its power over time, supposedly being fueled by the anomalous energy of the Zone.
